suggested_title: How will the Coronavirus change global politics? | DW Analysis
suggested_description:
The Coronavirus is sweeping around the world. It’s a global emergency like we’ve never seen before. Europe now has become epicentre of the Corona crisis. Italy is ground zero, and its healthcare system is buckling under the pressure. Scenes like this could come soon in Spain, France and Germany too. And European leaders are warning it could get much, much worse.

And the US isn’t far behind, although the president insists he is on top of things. But the markets don’t seem to agree. The economy is heading for a huge recession. 
 
Back in China, where it all began, the worst seemsto be over, at least for now. Infections are down dramatically from their peak and president Xi Jinping has been to visit healthcare workers in the city of Wuhan, which is China's ground zero. Some have even said China’s response is a model for the world. An extreme lockdown that helped to slow the virus’s spread, a makeshift hospital built in a matter of days, all made possible by an authoritarian regime that is able to act quickly and decisively. 

Is that true? Do you need to be a dictatorship to handle a killer virus? Are Europe and the US at a fatal disadvantage in tackling this intense crisis? We’re going to compare these three big players: China, where it all began, Europe, now at the centre of the pandemic, and the US, where infections are spreading fast. Our Analysis is taking a deep dive in what’s going wrong, what’s going right, and what global politics might look like after this crisis.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: UK government unveils aid for self-employed - BBC News
suggested_description:
Self-employed workers will be able to apply for a grant of up to £2,500 a month to help them cope with the financial impact of coronavirus, the chancellor has announced.

The money will be paid in a single lump sum, but will not begin to arrive until the start of June at the earliest.

Rishi Sunak told the self-employed: "You have not been forgotten."

Plans for 80% wage subsidies for staff kept on by employers were announced last week.

The chancellor spoke after the total number of people in the UK to die with Covid-19, the disease caused by coronavirus, reached 475.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: A quarter of the world’s population in lockdown - BBC News
suggested_description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told India’s population of 1.3 billion people to stay at home. The lockdown is currently planned for 3 weeks.
More than 2.6 billion people are in lockdown now India has introduced its new measures, according to a tally by the AFP news agency

Europe remains at the epicentre of the pandemic. On Tuesday, the death toll jumped by 514 in a single day in Spain and other European countries also reported sharp increases
Italy is the worst affected country in the world in terms of deaths. The virus has killed almost 7,000 people there over the past month
The UK, meanwhile, is spending its first day under tight new restrictions. Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced unprecedented measures on Monday and ordered the immediate closure of shops selling non-essential goods
And in the US, New York's governor has said the federal government is not sending enough equipment to combat the crisis. The state has been hit especially hard by the virus
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that the US has the potential to become the new epicentre of the pandemic

suggested_title: These Celebs Have Tested Positive For Coronavirus
suggested_description:
The coronavirus pandemic that popped up globally in 2019 and 2020 caught plenty of folks by surprise and it didn't take long for the world to learn that celebrities aren't immune to the virus, also known as COVID-19. Here are some of the high-profile actors, athletes, and politicians who have tested positive.

On March 11th, 2020, the NBA announced that it would suspend the remainder of its season, which naturally shocked fans. But the league had a good reason for doing so one of the players on the Utah Jazz tested positive for coronavirus. 

That baller turned out to be Rudy Gobert, who broke the news on his Instagram page, writing,

"The first and most important thing is I would like to publicly apologize to the people that I may have endangered. At the time, I had no idea I was even infected."

Gobert went on to acknowledge how careless he had been before learning about his diagnosis, and he encouraged people to learn from his mistake. He added,

"I will do whatever I can to support using my experience as a way to educate others and prevent the spread of this virus."

Unfortunately, Gobert wasn't the only NBA player to come down with coronavirus Utah Jazz teammate Donovan Mitchell also tested positive for the disease. And while he admitted he had to "cool off" after learning he had contracted the coronavirus from Gobert, Mitchell maintained a healthy perspective in a video-chat interview on Good Morning America.   Keep watching the video to see that these celebs have tested positive for Coronavirus.

#covid19 #coronavirus #corona

Rudy Gobert | 0:21
Donovan Mitchell | 1:11
Francis Suarez | 2:01
Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson | 2:53
Olga Kurylenko | 3:46
Idris Elba | 4:35

suggested_title: Corona Virus क्या गर्मी बढ़ने पर ख़त्म हो जाएगा? (BBC Hindi)
suggested_description:
कई जगह ये दावे किए जा रहे हैं कि गर्मी की मदद से कोरोना वायरस को ख़त्म किया जा सकता है. कई दावों में पानी को गर्म करके पीने की सलाह दी जा रही है. यहां तक कि नहाने के लिए गर्म पानी के इस्तेमाल की बात कही जा रही है. सोशल मीडिया पर क्या-क्या नहीं कहा जा रहा. अब जैसे इस एक पोस्ट को ही लीजिए..जिसे कई देशों में हज़ारों लोगों ने शेयर किया है, इसमें दावा किया जा रहा है कि गर्म पानी पीने और सूरज की रोशनी में रहने से इस वायरस को मारा जा सकता है. इस दावे में आइसक्रीम को ना खाने की सलाह भी दी जा रही है.इतना ही नहीं इस मैसेज के साथ फ़र्ज़ी तरीक़े से यह भी बताया जा रहा है कि ये तमाम बातें यूनिसेफ़ ने कही हैं.

suggested_description:

When it comes to future military technology, researchers and developers of military equipment strive to create advanced devices that will deliver the cutting edge on the battlefield. There are many different top-secret weapons, vehicles, and aircraft that are currently being developed. suggested_description:
Get Merch designed with ❤ from https://kgs.link/shop  
Join the Patreon Bird Army 🐧 https://kgs.link/patreon  
▼▼ More infos and links are just a click away ▼▼

A huge thanks to the experts who helped us on short notice with the video. Especially “Our World in Data”, the online publication for research and data on the world’s largest problems – and how to make progress solving them. Check out their site. It also includes a constantly updated page on the Corona Pandemic.

In December 2019 the Chinese authorities notified the world that a virus was spreading through their communities. In the following months it spread to other countries, with cases doubling within days. This virus is the “Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus 2”, that causes the disease called COVID19, and that everyone simply calls Coronavirus.

What actually happens when it infects a human and what should we all do?

suggested_title: Coronavirus Survivor Describes His Experience | Good Morning Britain
suggested_description:
Subscribe now for more! http://bit.ly/1NbomQa
Mark Stubbs was a superfit 28-year-old living life to the full - until he was struck down with the coronavirus and almost lost his life. Mark describes how although he was really healthy he felt like he had been struck by a bus, couldn't sit up in bed and was coughing up blood whilst in ICU for 13 days. Despite being a marathon runner with strong and healthy lungs, Mark still struggles with breathing and has liver damage with a long recovery still ahead. Mark has a stark warning for those who refuse to follow the government's guidelines.

Broadcast on 23/03/20

suggested_title: Got Mild Coronavirus Symptoms?  Tips On What To Do
suggested_description:
**THESE ARE SUGGESTIONS FOR THOSE WHO SHOW MILD SYMPTOMS, NOT SERIOUS SYMPTOMS.  IF YOU HAVE SYMPTOMS AND NOT SURE, CALL YOUR PHYSICIAN OR MEDICAL PRACTITIONER.  STAY CALM AND DON'T PANIC.  TAKE A DEEP BREATH.  DON'T LET ANXIETY OR FEAR OVERTAKE YOU.**

**MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: This video is for informational purposes only and not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis and treatment.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions regarding your medical condition.**

It’s hard to escape news on the Coronavirus and not get sucked in by the latest updates.  We have gone into self-quarantine, canceled events, canceled travel, work from home, run away when anyone sneezes or coughs.  

Some of us now know people who are showing Coronavirus symptoms - fever, cough, aches and pains, fatigue, headache, shortness of breath.  If these symptoms are MILD, then you should stay home and treat it as though it were the regular flu.   Call your regular physician or call telehealth provider.  You want to definitely get ahead of it and drink lots of liquids and get plenty of rest.   

In this video, I share 12 tips that you can implement at home should you start to develop COVID-19 symptoms.   Don't panic.  Everything is going to be fine.  Many of us will develop mild symptoms that will not be fatal.  There are some simple steps that we can all take to ensure that we don't get others sick.  Coronavirus anxiety is real and should be taken seriously but know that you can create a different mindset and change your approach to how you view this illness.  We will get through this.

Come and be social with us! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thisismodernaging/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thisismodernaging/ https://www.thisismodernaging.com 

Hosted by Risa Morimoto

suggested_title: How will the Coronavirus change global politics? | DW Analysis
suggested_description:
The Coronavirus is sweeping around the world. It’s a global emergency like we’ve never seen before. Europe now has become epicentre of the Corona crisis. Italy is ground zero, and its healthcare system is buckling under the pressure. Scenes like this could come soon in Spain, France and Germany too. And European leaders are warning it could get much, much worse.

And the US isn’t far behind, although the president insists he is on top of things. But the markets don’t seem to agree. The economy is heading for a huge recession. 
 
Back in China, where it all began, the worst seemsto be over, at least for now. Infections are down dramatically from their peak and president Xi Jinping has been to visit healthcare workers in the city of Wuhan, which is China's ground zero. Some have even said China’s response is a model for the world. An extreme lockdown that helped to slow the virus’s spread, a makeshift hospital built in a matter of days, all made possible by an authoritarian regime that is able to act quickly and decisively. 

Is that true? Do you need to be a dictatorship to handle a killer virus? Are Europe and the US at a fatal disadvantage in tackling this intense crisis? We’re going to compare these three big players: China, where it all began, Europe, now at the centre of the pandemic, and the US, where infections are spreading fast. Our Analysis is taking a deep dive in what’s going wrong, what’s going right, and what global politics might look like after this crisis. 
Subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/user/deutschewelleenglish?sub_confirmation=1

suggested_title: Coronavirus: UK government unveils aid for self-employed - BBC News
suggested_description:
Self-employed workers will be able to apply for a grant of up to £2,500 a month to help them cope with the financial impact of coronavirus, the chancellor has announced.

The money will be paid in a single lump sum, but will not begin to arrive until the start of June at the earliest.

Rishi Sunak told the self-employed: "You have not been forgotten."

Plans for 80% wage subsidies for staff kept on by employers were announced last week.

The chancellor spoke after the total number of people in the UK to die with Covid-19, the disease caused by coronavirus, reached 475.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: A quarter of the world’s population in lockdown - BBC News
suggested_description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told India’s population of 1.3 billion people to stay at home. The lockdown is currently planned for 3 weeks.
More than 2.6 billion people are in lockdown now India has introduced its new measures, according to a tally by the AFP news agency

Europe remains at the epicentre of the pandemic. On Tuesday, the death toll jumped by 514 in a single day in Spain and other European countries also reported sharp increases
Italy is the worst affected country in the world in terms of deaths. The virus has killed almost 7,000 people there over the past month
The UK, meanwhile, is spending its first day under tight new restrictions. Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced unprecedented measures on Monday and ordered the immediate closure of shops selling non-essential goods
And in the US, New York's governor has said the federal government is not sending enough equipment to combat the crisis. The state has been hit especially hard by the virus
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that the US has the potential to become the new epicentre of the pandemic

suggested_title: These Celebs Have Tested Positive For Coronavirus
suggested_description:
The coronavirus pandemic that popped up globally in 2019 and 2020 caught plenty of folks by surprise and it didn't take long for the world to learn that celebrities aren't immune to the virus, also known as COVID-19. Here are some of the high-profile actors, athletes, and politicians who have tested positive.

On March 11th, 2020, the NBA announced that it would suspend the remainder of its season, which naturally shocked fans. But the league had a good reason for doing so one of the players on the Utah Jazz tested positive for coronavirus. 

That baller turned out to be Rudy Gobert, who broke the news on his Instagram page, writing,

"The first and most important thing is I would like to publicly apologize to the people that I may have endangered. At the time, I had no idea I was even infected."

Gobert went on to acknowledge how careless he had been before learning about his diagnosis, and he encouraged people to learn from his mistake. He added,

"I will do whatever I can to support using my experience as a way to educate others and prevent the spread of this virus."

Unfortunately, Gobert wasn't the only NBA player to come down with coronavirus Utah Jazz teammate Donovan Mitchell also tested positive for the disease. And while he admitted he had to "cool off" after learning he had contracted the coronavirus from Gobert, Mitchell maintained a healthy perspective in a video-chat interview on Good Morning America.   Keep watching the video to see that these celebs have tested positive for Coronavirus.

#covid19 #coronavirus #corona

Rudy Gobert | 0:21
Donovan Mitchell | 1:11
Francis Suarez | 2:01
Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson | 2:53
Olga Kurylenko | 3:46
Idris Elba | 4:35

suggested_title: Corona Virus क्या गर्मी बढ़ने पर ख़त्म हो जाएगा? (BBC Hindi)
suggested_description:
कई जगह ये दावे किए जा रहे हैं कि गर्मी की मदद से कोरोना वायरस को ख़त्म किया जा सकता है. कई दावों में पानी को गर्म करके पीने की सलाह दी जा रही है. यहां तक कि नहाने के लिए गर्म पानी के इस्तेमाल की बात कही जा रही है. सोशल मीडिया पर क्या-क्या नहीं कहा जा रहा. अब जैसे इस एक पोस्ट को ही लीजिए..जिसे कई देशों में हज़ारों लोगों ने शेयर किया है, इसमें दावा किया जा रहा है कि गर्म पानी पीने और सूरज की रोशनी में रहने से इस वायरस को मारा जा सकता है. इस दावे में आइसक्रीम को ना खाने की सलाह भी दी जा रही है.इतना ही नहीं इस मैसेज के साथ फ़र्ज़ी तरीक़े से यह भी बताया जा रहा है कि ये तमाम बातें यूनिसेफ़ ने कही हैं.

suggested_title: The Coronavirus Explained & What You Should Do
suggested_description:
Get Merch designed with ❤ from https://kgs.link/shop  
Join the Patreon Bird Army 🐧 https://kgs.link/patreon  
▼▼ More infos and links are just a click away ▼▼

A huge thanks to the experts who helped us on short notice with the video. Especially “Our World in Data”, the online publication for research and data on the world’s largest problems – and how to make progress solving them. Check out their site. It also includes a constantly updated page on the Corona Pandemic.

In December 2019 the Chinese authorities notified the world that a virus was spreading through their communities. In the following months it spread to other countries, with cases doubling within days. This virus is the “Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus 2”, that causes the disease called COVID19, and that everyone simply calls Coronavirus.

What actually happens when it infects a human and what should we all do?

suggested_description:
ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਦਾ ਖੌਫ ਪੂਰੀ ਦੁਨੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਵੇਖਣ ਨੂੰ ਮਿਲ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਵਾਇਰਸ ਦੇ ਸੰਪਰਕ ਵਿੱਚ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਸ਼ਖ਼ਸ ਵਿੱਜ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਵਰਗੇ ਲੱਛਣ ਵੇਖੇ ਜਾ ਸਕਦੇ ਹਨ। ਪਰ ਕੀ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਤੋਂ ਪੀੜਤ ਹਰ ਵਿਅਕਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੈ ਇਹ ਪਤਾ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਲੱਗੇ, ਜਾਣੋ ਇਸ ਵੀਡੀਓ ਵਿੱਚ।

suggested_title: Coronavirus Survivor Describes His Experience | Good Morning Britain
suggested_description:
Subscribe now for more! http://bit.ly/1NbomQa
Mark Stubbs was a superfit 28-year-old living life to the full - until he was struck down with the coronavirus and almost lost his life. Mark describes how although he was really healthy he felt like he had been struck by a bus, couldn't sit up in bed and was coughing up blood whilst in ICU for 13 days. Despite being a marathon runner with strong and healthy lungs, Mark still struggles with breathing and has liver damage with a long recovery still ahead. Mark has a stark warning for those who refuse to follow the government's guidelines.

Broadcast on 23/03/20

suggested_title: Got Mild Coronavirus Symptoms?  Tips On What To Do
suggested_description:
**THESE ARE SUGGESTIONS FOR THOSE WHO SHOW MILD SYMPTOMS, NOT SERIOUS SYMPTOMS.  IF YOU HAVE SYMPTOMS AND NOT SURE, CALL YOUR PHYSICIAN OR MEDICAL PRACTITIONER.  STAY CALM AND DON'T PANIC.  TAKE A DEEP BREATH.  DON'T LET ANXIETY OR FEAR OVERTAKE YOU.**

**MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: This video is for informational purposes only and not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis and treatment.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions regarding your medical condition.**

It’s hard to escape news on the Coronavirus and not get sucked in by the latest updates.  We have gone into self-quarantine, canceled events, canceled travel, work from home, run away when anyone sneezes or coughs.  

Some of us now know people who are showing Coronavirus symptoms - fever, cough, aches and pains, fatigue, headache, shortness of breath.  If these symptoms are MILD, then you should stay home and treat it as though it were the regular flu.   Call your regular physician or call telehealth provider.  You want to definitely get ahead of it and drink lots of liquids and get plenty of rest.   

In this video, I share 12 tips that you can implement at home should you start to develop COVID-19 symptoms.   Don't panic.  Everything is going to be fine.  Many of us will develop mild symptoms that will not be fatal.  There are some simple steps that we can all take to ensure that we don't get others sick.  Coronavirus anxiety is real and should be taken seriously but know that you can create a different mindset and change your approach to how you view this illness.  We will get through this.

Come and be social with us! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thisismodernaging/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thisismodernaging/ https://www.thisismodernaging.com 

Hosted by Risa Morimoto

suggested_title: Coronavirus: UK government unveils aid for self-employed - BBC News
suggested_description:
Self-employed workers will be able to apply for a grant of up to £2,500 a month to help them cope with the financial impact of coronavirus, the chancellor has announced.

The money will be paid in a single lump sum, but will not begin to arrive until the start of June at the earliest.

Rishi Sunak told the self-employed: "You have not been forgotten."

Plans for 80% wage subsidies for staff kept on by employers were announced last week.

The chancellor spoke after the total number of people in the UK to die with Covid-19, the disease caused by coronavirus, reached 475.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: A quarter of the world’s population in lockdown - BBC News
suggested_description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told India’s population of 1.3 billion people to stay at home. The lockdown is currently planned for 3 weeks.
More than 2.6 billion people are in lockdown now India has introduced its new measures, according to a tally by the AFP news agency

Europe remains at the epicentre of the pandemic. On Tuesday, the death toll jumped by 514 in a single day in Spain and other European countries also reported sharp increases
Italy is the worst affected country in the world in terms of deaths. The virus has killed almost 7,000 people there over the past month
The UK, meanwhile, is spending its first day under tight new restrictions. Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced unprecedented measures on Monday and ordered the immediate closure of shops selling non-essential goods
And in the US, New York's governor has said the federal government is not sending enough equipment to combat the crisis. The state has been hit especially hard by the virus
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that the US has the potential to become the new epicentre of the pandemic

suggested_title: These Celebs Have Tested Positive For Coronavirus
suggested_description:
The coronavirus pandemic that popped up globally in 2019 and 2020 caught plenty of folks by surprise and it didn't take long for the world to learn that celebrities aren't immune to the virus, also known as COVID-19. Here are some of the high-profile actors, athletes, and politicians who have tested positive.

On March 11th, 2020, the NBA announced that it would suspend the remainder of its season, which naturally shocked fans. But the league had a good reason for doing so one of the players on the Utah Jazz tested positive for coronavirus. 

That baller turned out to be Rudy Gobert, who broke the news on his Instagram page, writing,

"The first and most important thing is I would like to publicly apologize to the people that I may have endangered. At the time, I had no idea I was even infected."

Gobert went on to acknowledge how careless he had been before learning about his diagnosis, and he encouraged people to learn from his mistake. He added,

"I will do whatever I can to support using my experience as a way to educate others and prevent the spread of this virus."

Unfortunately, Gobert wasn't the only NBA player to come down with coronavirus Utah Jazz teammate Donovan Mitchell also tested positive for the disease. And while he admitted he had to "cool off" after learning he had contracted the coronavirus from Gobert, Mitchell maintained a healthy perspective in a video-chat interview on Good Morning America.   Keep watching the video to see that these celebs have tested positive for Coronavirus.

#covid19 #coronavirus #corona

Rudy Gobert | 0:21
Donovan Mitchell | 1:11
Francis Suarez | 2:01
Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson | 2:53
Olga Kurylenko | 3:46
Idris Elba | 4:35

suggested_title: How is Africa coping with the coronavirus pandemic? | DW News
suggested_description:
As the coronavirus spreads around the world at an ever increasing rate, just over a hundred cases have been confirmed in twelve African countries. A small number compared to Europe where Italy alone has currently mor than 12,000 confirmed cases. But there are concerns that a wider outbreak there would overwhelm the already fragile healthcare system. Authorities fear that Africa es espacially vulnerable to an undetected spread of the virus. So how well is Africa prepared to cope with a coronavirus outbreak?

suggested_title: Corona Virus क्या गर्मी बढ़ने पर ख़त्म हो जाएगा? (BBC Hindi)
suggested_description:
कई जगह ये दावे किए जा रहे हैं कि गर्मी की मदद से कोरोना वायरस को ख़त्म किया जा सकता है. कई दावों में पानी को गर्म करके पीने की सलाह दी जा रही है. यहां तक कि नहाने के लिए गर्म पानी के इस्तेमाल की बात कही जा रही है. सोशल मीडिया पर क्या-क्या नहीं कहा जा रहा. अब जैसे इस एक पोस्ट को ही लीजिए..जिसे कई देशों में हज़ारों लोगों ने शेयर किया है, इसमें दावा किया जा रहा है कि गर्म पानी पीने और सूरज की रोशनी में रहने से इस वायरस को मारा जा सकता है. इस दावे में आइसक्रीम को ना खाने की सलाह भी दी जा रही है.इतना ही नहीं इस मैसेज के साथ फ़र्ज़ी तरीक़े से यह भी बताया जा रहा है कि ये तमाम बातें यूनिसेफ़ ने कही हैं.
वीडियोः सर्वप्रिया सांगवान/शाहनवाज़ अहमद

suggested_title: What Coronavirus Symptoms Look Like, Day By Day
suggested_description:
After being exposed to the virus that causes COVID-19, it can take as few as two and as many as 14 days for symptoms to develop. Cases range from mild to critical. The average timeline from the first symptom to recovery is about 17 days, but some cases are fatal. Here's what it looks like to develop COVID-19, day by day.

suggested_title: The Coronavirus Explained & What You Should Do
suggested_description:
Get Merch designed with ❤ from https://kgs.link/shop  
Join the Patreon Bird Army 🐧 https://kgs.link/patreon  
▼▼ More infos and links are just a click away ▼▼

A huge thanks to the experts who helped us on short notice with the video. Especially “Our World in Data”, the online publication for research and data on the world’s largest problems – and how to make progress solving them. Check out their site. It also includes a constantly updated page on the Corona Pandemic.

In December 2019 the Chinese authorities notified the world that a virus was spreading through their communities. In the following months it spread to other countries, with cases doubling within days. This virus is the “Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus 2”, that causes the disease called COVID19, and that everyone simply calls Coronavirus.

What actually happens when it infects a human and what should we all do?

Sources & further reading: https://sites.google.com/view/sourcescorona

suggested_title: Coronavirus Signs and Symptoms
suggested_description:
Learn how to recognise the basic signs and symptoms of Coronavirus. The symptoms are only a guide, however, as the severity varies greatly from one person to the next depending on a variety of risk factors.

Symptoms to watch out for may include: headache, tiredness, nasal congestion, sore throat, diarrhoea and muscle aches.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ, ਖੰਘ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੋ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ? ਕਿਵੇਂ ਪਤਾ ਲੱਗੇ | BBC NEWS PUNJABI
suggested_description:
ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਦਾ ਖੌਫ ਪੂਰੀ ਦੁਨੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਵੇਖਣ ਨੂੰ ਮਿਲ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਵਾਇਰਸ ਦੇ ਸੰਪਰਕ ਵਿੱਚ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਸ਼ਖ਼ਸ ਵਿੱਜ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਵਰਗੇ ਲੱਛਣ ਵੇਖੇ ਜਾ ਸਕਦੇ ਹਨ। ਪਰ ਕੀ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਤੋਂ ਪੀੜਤ ਹਰ ਵਿਅਕਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੈ ਇਹ ਪਤਾ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਲੱਗੇ, ਜਾਣੋ ਇਸ ਵੀਡੀਓ ਵਿੱਚ।
(ਵੀਡੀਓ: ਪ੍ਰਿਅੰਕਾ ਧੀਮਾਨ/ ਰਾਜਨ ਪਪਨੇਜਾ)

Mark Stubbs was a superfit 28-year-old living life to the full - until he was struck down with the coronavirus and almost lost his life. Mark describes how although he was really healthy he felt like he had been struck by a bus, couldn't sit up in bed and was coughing up blood whilst in ICU for 13 days. Despite being a marathon runner with strong and healthy lungs, Mark still struggles with breathing and has liver damage with a long recovery still ahead. Mark has a stark warning for those who refuse to follow the government's guidelines.

suggested_title: Got Mild Coronavirus Symptoms?  Tips On What To Do
suggested_description:
**THESE ARE SUGGESTIONS FOR THOSE WHO SHOW MILD SYMPTOMS, NOT SERIOUS SYMPTOMS.  IF YOU HAVE SYMPTOMS AND NOT SURE, CALL YOUR PHYSICIAN OR MEDICAL PRACTITIONER.  STAY CALM AND DON'T PANIC.  TAKE A DEEP BREATH.  DON'T LET ANXIETY OR FEAR OVERTAKE YOU.**

**MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: This video is for informational purposes only and not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis and treatment.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions regarding your medical condition.**

It’s hard to escape news on the Coronavirus and not get sucked in by the latest updates.  We have gone into self-quarantine, canceled events, canceled travel, work from home, run away when anyone sneezes or coughs.  

Some of us now know people who are showing Coronavirus symptoms - fever, cough, aches and pains, fatigue, headache, shortness of breath.  If these symptoms are MILD, then you should stay home and treat it as though it were the regular flu.   Call your regular physician or call telehealth provider.  You want to definitely get ahead of it and drink lots of liquids and get plenty of rest.   

In this video, I share 12 tips that you can implement at home should you start to develop COVID-19 symptoms.   Don't panic.  Everything is going to be fine.  Many of us will develop mild symptoms that will not be fatal.  There are some simple steps that we can all take to ensure that we don't get others sick.  Coronavirus anxiety is real and should be taken seriously but know that you can create a different mindset and change your approach to how you view this illness.  We will get through this.

Come and be social with us! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thisismodernaging/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thisismodernaging/ https://www.thisismodernaging.com 

Hosted by Risa Morimoto

suggested_title: How will the Coronavirus change global politics? | DW Analysis
suggested_description:
The Coronavirus is sweeping around the world. It’s a global emergency like we’ve never seen before. Europe now has become epicentre of the Corona crisis. Italy is ground zero, and its healthcare system is buckling under the pressure. Scenes like this could come soon in Spain, France and Germany too. And European leaders are warning it could get much, much worse.

And the US isn’t far behind, although the president insists he is on top of things. But the markets don’t seem to agree. The economy is heading for a huge recession. 
 
Back in China, where it all began, the worst seemsto be over, at least for now. Infections are down dramatically from their peak and president Xi Jinping has been to visit healthcare workers in the city of Wuhan, which is China's ground zero. Some have even said China’s response is a model for the world. An extreme lockdown that helped to slow the virus’s spread, a makeshift hospital built in a matter of days, all made possible by an authoritarian regime that is able to act quickly and decisively. 

Is that true? Do you need to be a dictatorship to handle a killer virus? Are Europe and the US at a fatal disadvantage in tackling this intense crisis? We’re going to compare these three big players: China, where it all began, Europe, now at the centre of the pandemic, and the US, where infections are spreading fast. Our Analysis is taking a deep dive in what’s going wrong, what’s going right, and what global politics might look like after this crisis.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: UK government unveils aid for self-employed - BBC News
suggested_description:
Self-employed workers will be able to apply for a grant of up to £2,500 a month to help them cope with the financial impact of coronavirus, the chancellor has announced.

The money will be paid in a single lump sum, but will not begin to arrive until the start of June at the earliest.

Rishi Sunak told the self-employed: "You have not been forgotten."

Plans for 80% wage subsidies for staff kept on by employers were announced last week.

The chancellor spoke after the total number of people in the UK to die with Covid-19, the disease caused by coronavirus, reached 475.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: A quarter of the world’s population in lockdown - BBC News
suggested_description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told India’s population of 1.3 billion people to stay at home. The lockdown is currently planned for 3 weeks.
More than 2.6 billion people are in lockdown now India has introduced its new measures, according to a tally by the AFP news agency

Europe remains at the epicentre of the pandemic. On Tuesday, the death toll jumped by 514 in a single day in Spain and other European countries also reported sharp increases
Italy is the worst affected country in the world in terms of deaths. The virus has killed almost 7,000 people there over the past month
The UK, meanwhile, is spending its first day under tight new restrictions. Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced unprecedented measures on Monday and ordered the immediate closure of shops selling non-essential goods
And in the US, New York's governor has said the federal government is not sending enough equipment to combat the crisis. The state has been hit especially hard by the virus
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that the US has the potential to become the new epicentre of the pandemic

suggested_title: These Celebs Have Tested Positive For Coronavirus
suggested_description:
The coronavirus pandemic that popped up globally in 2019 and 2020 caught plenty of folks by surprise and it didn't take long for the world to learn that celebrities aren't immune to the virus, also known as COVID-19. Here are some of the high-profile actors, athletes, and politicians who have tested positive.

On March 11th, 2020, the NBA announced that it would suspend the remainder of its season, which naturally shocked fans. But the league had a good reason for doing so one of the players on the Utah Jazz tested positive for coronavirus. 

That baller turned out to be Rudy Gobert, who broke the news on his Instagram page, writing,

"The first and most important thing is I would like to publicly apologize to the people that I may have endangered. At the time, I had no idea I was even infected."

Gobert went on to acknowledge how careless he had been before learning about his diagnosis, and he encouraged people to learn from his mistake. He added,

"I will do whatever I can to support using my experience as a way to educate others and prevent the spread of this virus."

Unfortunately, Gobert wasn't the only NBA player to come down with coronavirus Utah Jazz teammate Donovan Mitchell also tested positive for the disease. And while he admitted he had to "cool off" after learning he had contracted the coronavirus from Gobert, Mitchell maintained a healthy perspective in a video-chat interview on Good Morning America.   Keep watching the video to see that these celebs have tested positive for Coronavirus.

#covid19 #coronavirus #corona

Donovan Mitchell | 1:11
Francis Suarez | 2:01
Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson | 2:53
Olga Kurylenko | 3:46

suggested_title: How is Africa coping with the coronavirus pandemic? | DW News
suggested_description:
As the coronavirus spreads around the world at an ever increasing rate, just over a hundred cases have been confirmed in twelve African countries. A small number compared to Europe where Italy alone has currently mor than 12,000 confirmed cases. But there are concerns that a wider outbreak there would overwhelm the already fragile healthcare system. Authorities fear that Africa es espacially vulnerable to an undetected spread of the virus. So how well is Africa prepared to cope with a coronavirus outbreak?

suggested_title: Corona Virus क्या गर्मी बढ़ने पर ख़त्म हो जाएगा? (BBC Hindi)
suggested_description:
कई जगह ये दावे किए जा रहे हैं कि गर्मी की मदद से कोरोना वायरस को ख़त्म किया जा सकता है. कई दावों में पानी को गर्म करके पीने की सलाह दी जा रही है. यहां तक कि नहाने के लिए गर्म पानी के इस्तेमाल की बात कही जा रही है. सोशल मीडिया पर क्या-क्या नहीं कहा जा रहा. अब जैसे इस एक पोस्ट को ही लीजिए..जिसे कई देशों में हज़ारों लोगों ने शेयर किया है, इसमें दावा किया जा रहा है कि गर्म पानी पीने और सूरज की रोशनी में रहने से इस वायरस को मारा जा सकता है. इस दावे में आइसक्रीम को ना खाने की सलाह भी दी जा रही है.इतना ही नहीं इस मैसेज के साथ फ़र्ज़ी तरीक़े से यह भी बताया जा रहा है कि ये तमाम बातें यूनिसेफ़ ने कही हैं.
वीडियोः सर्वप्रिया सांगवान/शाहनवाज़ अहमद

suggested_title: What Coronavirus Symptoms Look Like, Day By Day
suggested_description:

suggested_title: The Coronavirus Explained & What You Should Do
suggested_description:
Get Merch designed with ❤ from https://kgs.link/shop  
Join the Patreon Bird Army 🐧 https://kgs.link/patreon  
▼▼ More infos and links are just a click away ▼▼

A huge thanks to the experts who helped us on short notice with the video. Especially “Our World in Data”, the online publication for research and data on the world’s largest problems – and how to make progress solving them. Check out their site. It also includes a constantly updated page on the Corona Pandemic.

In December 2019 the Chinese authorities notified the world that a virus was spreading through their communities. In the following months it spread to other countries, with cases doubling within days. This virus is the “Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus 2”, that causes the disease called COVID19, and that everyone simply calls Coronavirus.

What actually happens when it infects a human and what should we all do?

Sources & further reading: https://sites.google.com/view/sourcescorona

Learn how to recognise the basic signs and symptoms of Coronavirus. The symptoms are only a guide, however, as the severity varies greatly from one person to the next depending on a variety of risk factors.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ, ਖੰਘ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੋ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ? ਕਿਵੇਂ ਪਤਾ ਲੱਗੇ | BBC NEWS PUNJABI
suggested_description:
ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਦਾ ਖੌਫ ਪੂਰੀ ਦੁਨੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਵੇਖਣ ਨੂੰ ਮਿਲ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਵਾਇਰਸ ਦੇ ਸੰਪਰਕ ਵਿੱਚ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਸ਼ਖ਼ਸ ਵਿੱਜ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਵਰਗੇ ਲੱਛਣ ਵੇਖੇ ਜਾ ਸਕਦੇ ਹਨ। ਪਰ ਕੀ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਤੋਂ ਪੀੜਤ ਹਰ ਵਿਅਕਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੈ ਇਹ ਪਤਾ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਲੱਗੇ, ਜਾਣੋ ਇਸ ਵੀਡੀਓ ਵਿੱਚ।
(ਵੀਡੀਓ: ਪ੍ਰਿਅੰਕਾ ਧੀਮਾਨ/ ਰਾਜਨ ਪਪਨੇਜਾ)

Mark Stubbs was a superfit 28-year-old living life to the full - until he was struck down with the coronavirus and almost lost his life. Mark describes how although he was really healthy he felt like he had been struck by a bus, couldn't sit up in bed and was coughing up blood whilst in ICU for 13 days. Despite being a marathon runner with strong and healthy lungs, Mark still struggles with breathing and has liver damage with a long recovery still ahead. Mark has a stark warning for those who refuse to follow the government's guidelines.

suggested_title: Got Mild Coronavirus Symptoms?  Tips On What To Do
suggested_description:
**THESE ARE SUGGESTIONS FOR THOSE WHO SHOW MILD SYMPTOMS, NOT SERIOUS SYMPTOMS.  IF YOU HAVE SYMPTOMS AND NOT SURE, CALL YOUR PHYSICIAN OR MEDICAL PRACTITIONER.  STAY CALM AND DON'T PANIC.  TAKE A DEEP BREATH.  DON'T LET ANXIETY OR FEAR OVERTAKE YOU.**

**MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: This video is for informational purposes only and not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis and treatment.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions regarding your medical condition.**

It’s hard to escape news on the Coronavirus and not get sucked in by the latest updates.  We have gone into self-quarantine, canceled events, canceled travel, work from home, run away when anyone sneezes or coughs.  

Some of us now know people who are showing Coronavirus symptoms - fever, cough, aches and pains, fatigue, headache, shortness of breath.  If these symptoms are MILD, then you should stay home and treat it as though it were the regular flu.   Call your regular physician or call telehealth provider.  You want to definitely get ahead of it and drink lots of liquids and get plenty of rest.   

In this video, I share 12 tips that you can implement at home should you start to develop COVID-19 symptoms.   Don't panic.  Everything is going to be fine.  Many of us will develop mild symptoms that will not be fatal.  There are some simple steps that we can all take to ensure that we don't get others sick.  Coronavirus anxiety is real and should be taken seriously but know that you can create a different mindset and change your approach to how you view this illness.  We will get through this.

Come and be social with us! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thisismodernaging/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thisismodernaging/ https://www.thisismodernaging.com 

Hosted by Risa Morimoto

suggested_title: Coronavirus: UK government unveils aid for self-employed - BBC News
suggested_description:
Self-employed workers will be able to apply for a grant of up to £2,500 a month to help them cope with the financial impact of coronavirus, the chancellor has announced.

The money will be paid in a single lump sum, but will not begin to arrive until the start of June at the earliest.

Rishi Sunak told the self-employed: "You have not been forgotten."

Plans for 80% wage subsidies for staff kept on by employers were announced last week.

The chancellor spoke after the total number of people in the UK to die with Covid-19, the disease caused by coronavirus, reached 475.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: A quarter of the world’s population in lockdown - BBC News
suggested_description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told India’s population of 1.3 billion people to stay at home. The lockdown is currently planned for 3 weeks.
More than 2.6 billion people are in lockdown now India has introduced its new measures, according to a tally by the AFP news agency

Europe remains at the epicentre of the pandemic. On Tuesday, the death toll jumped by 514 in a single day in Spain and other European countries also reported sharp increases
Italy is the worst affected country in the world in terms of deaths. The virus has killed almost 7,000 people there over the past month
The UK, meanwhile, is spending its first day under tight new restrictions. Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced unprecedented measures on Monday and ordered the immediate closure of shops selling non-essential goods
And in the US, New York's governor has said the federal government is not sending enough equipment to combat the crisis. The state has been hit especially hard by the virus
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that the US has the potential to become the new epicentre of the pandemic

suggested_title: These Celebs Have Tested Positive For Coronavirus
suggested_description:
The coronavirus pandemic that popped up globally in 2019 and 2020 caught plenty of folks by surprise and it didn't take long for the world to learn that celebrities aren't immune to the virus, also known as COVID-19. Here are some of the high-profile actors, athletes, and politicians who have tested positive.

On March 11th, 2020, the NBA announced that it would suspend the remainder of its season, which naturally shocked fans. But the league had a good reason for doing so one of the players on the Utah Jazz tested positive for coronavirus. 

That baller turned out to be Rudy Gobert, who broke the news on his Instagram page, writing,

"The first and most important thing is I would like to publicly apologize to the people that I may have endangered. At the time, I had no idea I was even infected."

Gobert went on to acknowledge how careless he had been before learning about his diagnosis, and he encouraged people to learn from his mistake. He added,

"I will do whatever I can to support using my experience as a way to educate others and prevent the spread of this virus."

Unfortunately, Gobert wasn't the only NBA player to come down with coronavirus Utah Jazz teammate Donovan Mitchell also tested positive for the disease. And while he admitted he had to "cool off" after learning he had contracted the coronavirus from Gobert, Mitchell maintained a healthy perspective in a video-chat interview on Good Morning America.   Keep watching the video to see that these celebs have tested positive for Coronavirus.

#covid19 #coronavirus #corona

Donovan Mitchell | 1:11
Francis Suarez | 2:01
Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson | 2:53
Olga Kurylenko | 3:46

suggested_title: How is Africa coping with the coronavirus pandemic? | DW News
suggested_description:
As the coronavirus spreads around the world at an ever increasing rate, just over a hundred cases have been confirmed in twelve African countries. A small number compared to Europe where Italy alone has currently mor than 12,000 confirmed cases. But there are concerns that a wider outbreak there would overwhelm the already fragile healthcare system. Authorities fear that Africa es espacially vulnerable to an undetected spread of the virus. So how well is Africa prepared to cope with a coronavirus outbreak?

suggested_title: Corona Virus क्या गर्मी बढ़ने पर ख़त्म हो जाएगा? (BBC Hindi)
suggested_description:
कई जगह ये दावे किए जा रहे हैं कि गर्मी की मदद से कोरोना वायरस को ख़त्म किया जा सकता है. कई दावों में पानी को गर्म करके पीने की सलाह दी जा रही है. यहां तक कि नहाने के लिए गर्म पानी के इस्तेमाल की बात कही जा रही है. सोशल मीडिया पर क्या-क्या नहीं कहा जा रहा. अब जैसे इस एक पोस्ट को ही लीजिए..जिसे कई देशों में हज़ारों लोगों ने शेयर किया है, इसमें दावा किया जा रहा है कि गर्म पानी पीने और सूरज की रोशनी में रहने से इस वायरस को मारा जा सकता है. इस दावे में आइसक्रीम को ना खाने की सलाह भी दी जा रही है.इतना ही नहीं इस मैसेज के साथ फ़र्ज़ी तरीक़े से यह भी बताया जा रहा है कि ये तमाम बातें यूनिसेफ़ ने कही हैं.

suggested_title: What Coronavirus Symptoms Look Like, Day By Day
suggested_description:

suggested_title: The Coronavirus Explained & What You Should Do
suggested_description:
Get Merch designed with ❤ from https://kgs.link/shop  
Join the Patreon Bird Army 🐧 https://kgs.link/patreon  
▼▼ More infos and links are just a click away ▼▼

A huge thanks to the experts who helped us on short notice with the video. Especially “Our World in Data”, the online publication for research and data on the world’s largest problems – and how to make progress solving them. Check out their site. It also includes a constantly updated page on the Corona Pandemic.

In December 2019 the Chinese authorities notified the world that a virus was spreading through their communities. In the following months it spread to other countries, with cases doubling within days. This virus is the “Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus 2”, that causes the disease called COVID19, and that everyone simply calls Coronavirus.

What actually happens when it infects a human and what should we all do?

suggested_title: Coronavirus Signs and Symptoms
suggested_description:
Learn how to recognise the basic signs and symptoms of Coronavirus. The symptoms are only a guide, however, as the severity varies greatly from one person to the next depending on a variety of risk factors.

Symptoms to watch out for may include: headache, tiredness, nasal congestion, sore throat, diarrhoea and muscle aches.

Watch the full Coronavirus course for FREE at: https://www.ProCoronavirus.co.uk/ (certificate and CPD credit are available for a small fee).

suggested_title: Coronavirus: ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ, ਖੰਘ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੋ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ? ਕਿਵੇਂ ਪਤਾ ਲੱਗੇ | BBC NEWS PUNJABI
suggested_description:
ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਦਾ ਖੌਫ ਪੂਰੀ ਦੁਨੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਵੇਖਣ ਨੂੰ ਮਿਲ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਵਾਇਰਸ ਦੇ ਸੰਪਰਕ ਵਿੱਚ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਸ਼ਖ਼ਸ ਵਿੱਜ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਵਰਗੇ ਲੱਛਣ ਵੇਖੇ ਜਾ ਸਕਦੇ ਹਨ। ਪਰ ਕੀ ਬੁਖ਼ਾਰ ਤੇ ਖੰਘ ਤੋਂ ਪੀੜਤ ਹਰ ਵਿਅਕਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਹੈ ਇਹ ਪਤਾ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਲੱਗੇ, ਜਾਣੋ ਇਸ ਵੀਡੀਓ ਵਿੱਚ।

suggested_title: Coronavirus Survivor Describes His Experience | Good Morning Britain
suggested_description:
Subscribe now for more! http://bit.ly/1NbomQa
Mark Stubbs was a superfit 28-year-old living life to the full - until he was struck down with the coronavirus and almost lost his life. Mark describes how although he was really healthy he felt like he had been struck by a bus, couldn't sit up in bed and was coughing up blood whilst in ICU for 13 days. Despite being a marathon runner with strong and healthy lungs, Mark still struggles with breathing and has liver damage with a long recovery still ahead. Mark has a stark warning for those who refuse to follow the government's guidelines.

Broadcast on 23/03/20

suggested_title: Got Mild Coronavirus Symptoms?  Tips On What To Do
suggested_description:
**THESE ARE SUGGESTIONS FOR THOSE WHO SHOW MILD SYMPTOMS, NOT SERIOUS SYMPTOMS.  IF YOU HAVE SYMPTOMS AND NOT SURE, CALL YOUR PHYSICIAN OR MEDICAL PRACTITIONER.  STAY CALM AND DON'T PANIC.  TAKE A DEEP BREATH.  DON'T LET ANXIETY OR FEAR OVERTAKE YOU.**

**MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: This video is for informational purposes only and not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis and treatment.  Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions regarding your medical condition.**

It’s hard to escape news on the Coronavirus and not get sucked in by the latest updates.  We have gone into self-quarantine, canceled events, canceled travel, work from home, run away when anyone sneezes or coughs.  

Some of us now know people who are showing Coronavirus symptoms - fever, cough, aches and pains, fatigue, headache, shortness of breath.  If these symptoms are MILD, then you should stay home and treat it as though it were the regular flu.   Call your regular physician or call telehealth provider.  You want to definitely get ahead of it and drink lots of liquids and get plenty of rest.   

In this video, I share 12 tips that you can implement at home should you start to develop COVID-19 symptoms.   Don't panic.  Everything is going to be fine.  Many of us will develop mild symptoms that will not be fatal.  There are some simple steps that we can all take to ensure that we don't get others sick.  Coronavirus anxiety is real and should be taken seriously but know that you can create a different mindset and change your approach to how you view this illness.  We will get through this.

Come and be social with us! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thisismodernaging/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thisismodernaging/ https://www.thisismodernaging.com 

Hosted by Risa Morimoto

suggested_title: Coronavirus: A quarter of the world’s population in lockdown - BBC News
suggested_description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told India’s population of 1.3 billion people to stay at home. The lockdown is currently planned for 3 weeks.
More than 2.6 billion people are in lockdown now India has introduced its new measures, according to a tally by the AFP news agency

Europe remains at the epicentre of the pandemic. On Tuesday, the death toll jumped by 514 in a single day in Spain and other European countries also reported sharp increases
Italy is the worst affected country in the world in terms of deaths. The virus has killed almost 7,000 people there over the past month
The UK, meanwhile, is spending its first day under tight new restrictions. Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced unprecedented measures on Monday and ordered the immediate closure of shops selling non-essential goods
And in the US, New York's governor has said the federal government is not sending enough equipment to combat the crisis. The state has been hit especially hard by the virus
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned that the US has the potential to become the new epicentre of the pandemic

suggested_title: These Celebs Have Tested Positive For Coronavirus
suggested_description:
The coronavirus pandemic that popped up globally in 2019 and 2020 caught plenty of folks by surprise and it didn't take long for the world to learn that celebrities aren't immune to the virus, also known as COVID-19. Here are some of the high-profile actors, athletes, and politicians who have tested positive.

On March 11th, 2020, the NBA announced that it would suspend the remainder of its season, which naturally shocked fans. But the league had a good reason for doing so one of the players on the Utah Jazz tested positive for coronavirus. 

That baller turned out to be Rudy Gobert, who broke the news on his Instagram page, writing,

"The first and most important thing is I would like to publicly apologize to the people that I may have endangered. At the time, I had no idea I was even infected."

Gobert went on to acknowledge how careless he had been before learning about his diagnosis, and he encouraged people to learn from his mistake. He added,

"I will do whatever I can to support using my experience as a way to educate others and prevent the spread of this virus."

Unfortunately, Gobert wasn't the only NBA player to come down with coronavirus Utah Jazz teammate Donovan Mitchell also tested positive for the disease. And while he admitted he had to "cool off" after learning he had contracted the coronavirus from Gobert, Mitchell maintained a healthy perspective in a video-chat interview on Good Morning America.   Keep watching the video to see that these celebs have tested positive for Coronavirus.

suggested_title: Corona Virus क्या गर्मी बढ़ने पर ख़त्म हो जाएगा? (BBC Hindi)
suggested_description:
कई जगह ये दावे किए जा रहे हैं कि गर्मी की मदद से कोरोना वायरस को ख़त्म किया जा सकता है. कई दावों में पानी को गर्म करके पीने की सलाह दी जा रही है. यहां तक कि नहाने के लिए गर्म पानी के इस्तेमाल की बात कही जा रही है. सोशल मीडिया पर क्या-क्या नहीं कहा जा रहा. अब जैसे इस एक पोस्ट को ही लीजिए..जिसे कई देशों में हज़ारों लोगों ने शेयर किया है, इसमें दावा किया जा रहा है कि गर्म पानी पीने और सूरज की रोशनी में रहने से इस वायरस को मारा जा सकता है. इस दावे में आइसक्रीम को ना खाने की सलाह भी दी जा रही है.इतना ही नहीं इस मैसेज के साथ फ़र्ज़ी तरीक़े से यह भी बताया जा रहा है कि ये तमाम बातें यूनिसेफ़ ने कही हैं.

suggested_title: Coronavirus: Spain sees record 514 deaths in one day - BBC News
suggested_description:
It's another dark day for Spain with a total of 39,763 cases of coronavirus confirmed across the country. Another 6,582 infections have been announced in the past 24 hours and the number of deaths has now reached 2,696.

The capital Madrid continues to be the epicentre of Spain's pandemic, with 1,535 deaths. The north-east region of Catalonia is now also becoming a big cause for concern with 1,939 cases in the past day, higher than Madrid.

Health emergency chief Fernando Simón has stressed that almost 3,800 people have now recovered from the virus but 2,636 remain in intensive care.

"This is a tough week and we are all hoping to see if we are managing to reach the peak and start going down, with these very aggressive measures that have been imposed on Spain".

Attention has also turned to the alarming rate of infection among health professionals. Of the 39,763 infected people around the country, 5,400 are healthcare staff - meaning they make up nearly 14% of those with the disease.

The government has asked MPs to extend the state of alert to 11 April.

suggested_title: Epicentro - 24h em Wuhan | Documentário
suggested_description:
Neste documentário produzido pela CGTN - China Global Television Network, saiba mais sobre o início da crise de saúde pública na China que se transformou numa pandemia: o COVID-19. 

O novo coronavírus começou a circular durante a temporada de viagens mais movimentada na China, na qual milhões visitam suas famílias no feriado do Ano Novo Lunar. Em meio ao crescimento da epidemia, uma Wuhan sitiada se mobiliza para salvar aqueles que estão no epicentro da emergência. Numa manobra sem precedentes, a China isolou a grande metrópole na esperança de impedir a disseminação do vírus.

suggested_description:

A Covid-19, doença provocada pelo novo coronavírus, é nova no mundo da medicina, e por isso muitos médicos e pesquisadores têm dificuldade em traçar estratégias de combate ao patógeno.

suggested_title: Coronavírus: a cronologia do caos e a ciência na busca por uma saída | Futurando especial
suggested_description:
Confira nesta edição do Futurando especial sobre coronavírus:

1:21 A cronologia do caos: o Futurando refaz a linha do tempo do coronavírus, desde quando, como e onde ele surgiu, em Wuhan, na China, no começo de dezembro de 2019, até quando se espalhou para o mundo todo. 

4:37 Cientistas de todo o mundo estão empenhados em encontrar o mais rapidamente possível uma vacina contra a covid-19, mas ela ainda deve demorar pelo menos um ano e meio para ficar pronta. Por isso, outras ações também são importantes. O Futurando conversou com equipes que analisam, por exemplo, onde o novo coronavírus se multiplica no corpo e que danos pode causar, e com cientistas que querem entender o fluxo de propagação da doença.

8:05 Já se sabe que contrair o coronavírus é muito mais grave para pessoas dos chamados grupos de risco, que incluem pessoas com problemas respiratórios e cardíacos pré-existentes e diabéticos. O programa entrevista especialistas e explica por que cada um desses fatores agrava o quadro dos infectados e que medidas podem ser tomadas para tentar evitar a contaminação. 

13:34 Além de pesquisar uma vacina, grupos de cientistas também se dedicam a desenvolver um medicamento para tratar a covid-19. Na Alemanha, um time estuda com sucesso há muito tempo formas de inibir os vírus ebola, lassa e zika. Acredita-se que essas pesquisas possam ajudar a produzir um medicamento para a doença causada pelo novo coronavírus.

19:27 Muitos países fecharam as fronteiras para conter a disseminação do coronavírus e milhares de voos e muitos cruzeiros foram cancelados. O Futurando conversou com especialistas para saber o quão perigoso é viajar de avião ou de navio. 

22:27 As previsões mais otimistas indicam que uma vacina contra a covid-19 estará pronta em, no mínimo, um ano e meio, apesar dos esforços conjuntos de vários países. Por isso, é importante também investigar alternativas para tratar os pacientes que já estão doentes, uma delas é a imunização passiva. O Futurando explica de que se trata.

suggested_title: Coronavírus: por que há baixa incidência em crianças?
suggested_description:
Um bebê, nascido no dia 5 de fevereiro, é o paciente mais jovem infectado no surto que já matou mais de mil pessoas e infectou cerca de 40 mil (99% na China, embora casos tenham sido detectados em mais de 30 países e territórios).

Um dos mais recentes estudos do surto foi publicado no Journal of the American Medical Association e analisa pacientes do hospital Jinyintan, na cidade de Wuhan, epicentro do surto.

Segundo os dados analisados pelos pesquisadores, metade de todas as pessoas infectadas pelo vírus eram adultos com idade entre 40 e 59 anos. Somente 10% dos pacientes têm menos de 39 anos.


Leia mais: https://www.bbc.com/portuguese/internacional-51460607

suggested_title: Morre médico chinês punido por alertar colegas sobre coronavírus
suggested_description: O médico chinês que foi punido pelo governo por alertar colegas após os primeiros casos do novo coronavírus morreu. Li Wenliang, do Hospital Central de Wuhan, na China, tinha 34 anos, e foi contaminado pelo vírus. Ele estava internado desde 12 de janeiro. A BBC reportou que o médico enviou mensagens a colegas em 30 de dezembro, quando as autoridades de Wuhan ainda tentavam manter a situação sob controle. O oftalmologista recomendava aos demais profissionais que se protegessem para evitar a contaminação, enquanto o governo local não indicava qualquer medida de prevenção em hospitais.

suggested_title: Como o Coronavírus pode levar a Morte | IMEB
suggested_description:
Quer se informar melhor sobre o Coronavírus? Baixe a nossa CARTILHA COMPLETA E GRATUITA sobre o assunto, com todas as principais dúvidas da população esclarecidas em um só lugar. Acesse gratuitamente agora mesmo: https://conteudos.imeb.com.br/cartilha-coronavirus

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Neste vídeo, o Dr. Renato Barra, médico do IMEB - Imagens Médicas de Brasília, esclarece os riscos de morte por coronavírus.

Apesar da maioria das pessoas infectadas com coronavírus apresentarem sintomas leves, o vírus também pode provocar sintomas mais graves e até levar ao óbito.

Alguns fatores aumentam as chances de complicações que podem levar ao óbito por coronavírus, como maior idade do paciente, doenças prévias (como doenças cardiovasculares, diabetes, doença pulmonar obstrutiva crônica), além de pessoas do sexo masculino.

Nos casos de morte por coronavírus até o momento, a grande parte dos pacientes se encaixavam nesses fatores de risco apresentados e evoluíram para um quadro de pneumonia progressiva até desenvolverem insuficiência respiratória.

Após isso, foram internados no hospital e encaminhados para a UTI, dependentes de oxigênio, até evoluírem para um quadro de Síndrome Respiratória Aguda Grave, insuficiência renal e, posteriormente, sendo levados ao óbito.

Até o momento da gravação deste vídeo, a taxa de mortalidade do coronavírus era de cerca de 3,4% dos casos. Esse percentual, porém, é menor que outras infecções respiratórias conhecidas na história, como a da Síndrome Respiratória Aguda Grave - SARS (9,5%) e da Síndrome Respiratória do Oriente Médio - MERS, que chegou a uma taxa de mortalidade de 35%.

Portanto, vale ressaltar que a taxa de mortalidade do coronavírus é baixa.

Para mais informações, acompanhe a série de vídeos presentes no nosso canal, em que o Dr. Renato esclarece dúvidas e as principais perguntas sobre o coronavírus.

Leia também o nosso artigo especial sobre o assunto, esclarecendo as principais dúvidas da população:
Coronavírus: especialista esclarece tudo o que se sabe até agora - https://imeb.com.br/coronavirus-tudo-o-que-se-sabe-ate-agora/

SOBRE A REVISTA FÓRUM 

Inspirada no Fórum Social Mundial, a Fórum foi lançada com a cobertura do primeiro evento, realizado em janeiro de 2001 em Porto Alegre. Foi lá na Porto Alegre daqueles que sonhavam um outro mundo possível que a Fórum nasceu. Não é a publicação oficial do FSM, mas a revista traz no seu DNA a força dos movimentos e a certeza de que é na multiplicidade de vozes que se faz um mundo melhor.

O número zero foi lançado em abril daquele 2001 e, devido ao sucesso junto aos movimentos sociais brasileiros, tornou-se periódica ainda em setembro. Até dezembro de 2013, suas edições em papel tiveram circulação mensal de 20 a 25 mil exemplares e eram vendidas em banca. Desde janeiro de 2014, a Fórum é só digital.

Fórum traz, diariamente, matérias, reportagens e entrevistas que buscam uma visão de mundo diferente da presente nos grandes meios de comunicação tradicionais. Hoje é uma das maiores audiências no segmento jornalístico nacional.

suggested_title: Epicentro - 24h em Wuhan | Documentário
suggested_description:
Neste documentário produzido pela CGTN - China Global Television Network, saiba mais sobre o início da crise de saúde pública na China que se transformou numa pandemia: o COVID-19. 

O novo coronavírus começou a circular durante a temporada de viagens mais movimentada na China, na qual milhões visitam suas famílias no feriado do Ano Novo Lunar. Em meio ao crescimento da epidemia, uma Wuhan sitiada se mobiliza para salvar aqueles que estão no epicentro da emergência. Numa manobra sem precedentes, a China isolou a grande metrópole na esperança de impedir a disseminação do vírus.

A Covid-19, doença provocada pelo novo coronavírus, é nova no mundo da medicina, e por isso muitos médicos e pesquisadores têm dificuldade em traçar estratégias de combate ao patógeno.

suggested_title: Coronavírus: a cronologia do caos e a ciência na busca por uma saída | Futurando especial
suggested_description:
Confira nesta edição do Futurando especial sobre coronavírus:

1:21 A cronologia do caos: o Futurando refaz a linha do tempo do coronavírus, desde quando, como e onde ele surgiu, em Wuhan, na China, no começo de dezembro de 2019, até quando se espalhou para o mundo todo. 

4:37 Cientistas de todo o mundo estão empenhados em encontrar o mais rapidamente possível uma vacina contra a covid-19, mas ela ainda deve demorar pelo menos um ano e meio para ficar pronta. Por isso, outras ações também são importantes. O Futurando conversou com equipes que analisam, por exemplo, onde o novo coronavírus se multiplica no corpo e que danos pode causar, e com cientistas que querem entender o fluxo de propagação da doença.

8:05 Já se sabe que contrair o coronavírus é muito mais grave para pessoas dos chamados grupos de risco, que incluem pessoas com problemas respiratórios e cardíacos pré-existentes e diabéticos. O programa entrevista especialistas e explica por que cada um desses fatores agrava o quadro dos infectados e que medidas podem ser tomadas para tentar evitar a contaminação. 

13:34 Além de pesquisar uma vacina, grupos de cientistas também se dedicam a desenvolver um medicamento para tratar a covid-19. Na Alemanha, um time estuda com sucesso há muito tempo formas de inibir os vírus ebola, lassa e zika. Acredita-se que essas pesquisas possam ajudar a produzir um medicamento para a doença causada pelo novo coronavírus.

19:27 Muitos países fecharam as fronteiras para conter a disseminação do coronavírus e milhares de voos e muitos cruzeiros foram cancelados. O Futurando conversou com especialistas para saber o quão perigoso é viajar de avião ou de navio. 

22:27 As previsões mais otimistas indicam que uma vacina contra a covid-19 estará pronta em, no mínimo, um ano e meio, apesar dos esforços conjuntos de vários países. Por isso, é importante também investigar alternativas para tratar os pacientes que já estão doentes, uma delas é a imunização passiva. O Futurando explica de que se trata.

suggested_title: Trabalhadores Rodoviários Encontraram Esta Estranha Caixa Enterrada. Veja o Que Havia Dentro Dela!
suggested_description: A civilização humana existe há muito mais de mil anos e a profissão de construtor existe basicamente a mesma quantidade de tempo. As pessoas começaram a construir prédios arquitetônicos na antiguidade e foram passando essa experiência inestimável de geração em geração. Um belo exemplo são as pirâmides egípcias que tem segredos de construção que não foram descobertos até hoje. Em casos raros, o construtor também pode se tornar um arqueólogo, se durante o trabalho algo inesperado foi descoberto acidentalmente no solo. No vídeo de hoje, falaremos justamente sobre as descobertas mais incríveis, encontradas na terra por trabalhadores comuns.

suggested_title: Coronavírus: A rotina dos médicos do Hospital Albert Einstein na luta contra o avanço do covid-19
suggested_description:
A reportagem de VEJA esteve durante dois dias no front do Hospital Albert Einstein, em São Paulo, instituição que confirmou o primeiro caso de coronavírus no Brasil.

Ao longo de 48 horas, VEJA foi autorizada a entrar no coração do hospital, de modo a ver de perto o cotidiano heroico dos profissionais de saúde frente ao coronavírus.

São mulheres e homens, alguns na linha de frente, em contato direto com doentes infectados com o novo vírus, outros em laboratórios, mas todos absolutamente imbuídos de uma missão: salvar vidas e proteger os enfermos. 

Acompanhe os relatos emocionantes desses profissionais. 

#Coronavírus # Covid-19 #VEJA

suggested_title: Porque é que o coronavírus - Covid-19 - apareceu na China?
suggested_description:
O coronavírus - covid-19 - tem como origem provável um mercado de animais vivos em Wuhan, na China.

Muitos dos vírus que atacam o ser humano têm origem noutros animais. E alguns deles em animais selvagens.

Na China, apesar de haver um movimento popular grande para banir o comércio de animais selvagens - alguns ameaçados de extinção - este comércio continua a acontecer.

suggested_title: Coronavírus: por que há baixa incidência em crianças?
suggested_description:
Um bebê, nascido no dia 5 de fevereiro, é o paciente mais jovem infectado no surto que já matou mais de mil pessoas e infectou cerca de 40 mil (99% na China, embora casos tenham sido detectados em mais de 30 países e territórios).

Um dos mais recentes estudos do surto foi publicado no Journal of the American Medical Association e analisa pacientes do hospital Jinyintan, na cidade de Wuhan, epicentro do surto.

Segundo os dados analisados pelos pesquisadores, metade de todas as pessoas infectadas pelo vírus eram adultos com idade entre 40 e 59 anos. Somente 10% dos pacientes têm menos de 39 anos.


Leia mais: https://www.bbc.com/portuguese/internacional-51460607



Curtiu? Inscreva-se no canal da BBC News Brasil! E se quiser ler mais notícias, clique aqui:  www.bbc.co.uk/portuguese

suggested_title: Morre médico chinês punido por alertar colegas sobre coronavírus
suggested_description: O médico chinês que foi punido pelo governo por alertar colegas após os primeiros casos do novo coronavírus morreu. Li Wenliang, do Hospital Central de Wuhan, na China, tinha 34 anos, e foi contaminado pelo vírus. Ele estava internado desde 12 de janeiro. A BBC reportou que o médico enviou mensagens a colegas em 30 de dezembro, quando as autoridades de Wuhan ainda tentavam manter a situação sob controle. O oftalmologista recomendava aos demais profissionais que se protegessem para evitar a contaminação, enquanto o governo local não indicava qualquer medida de prevenção em hospitais.

suggested_title: Como o Coronavírus pode levar a Morte | IMEB
suggested_description:
Quer se informar melhor sobre o Coronavírus? Baixe a nossa CARTILHA COMPLETA E GRATUITA sobre o assunto, com todas as principais dúvidas da população esclarecidas em um só lugar. Acesse gratuitamente agora mesmo: https://conteudos.imeb.com.br/cartilha-coronavirus

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Neste vídeo, o Dr. Renato Barra, médico do IMEB - Imagens Médicas de Brasília, esclarece os riscos de morte por coronavírus.

Apesar da maioria das pessoas infectadas com coronavírus apresentarem sintomas leves, o vírus também pode provocar sintomas mais graves e até levar ao óbito.

Alguns fatores aumentam as chances de complicações que podem levar ao óbito por coronavírus, como maior idade do paciente, doenças prévias (como doenças cardiovasculares, diabetes, doença pulmonar obstrutiva crônica), além de pessoas do sexo masculino.

Nos casos de morte por coronavírus até o momento, a grande parte dos pacientes se encaixavam nesses fatores de risco apresentados e evoluíram para um quadro de pneumonia progressiva até desenvolverem insuficiência respiratória.

Após isso, foram internados no hospital e encaminhados para a UTI, dependentes de oxigênio, até evoluírem para um quadro de Síndrome Respiratória Aguda Grave, insuficiência renal e, posteriormente, sendo levados ao óbito.

Até o momento da gravação deste vídeo, a taxa de mortalidade do coronavírus era de cerca de 3,4% dos casos. Esse percentual, porém, é menor que outras infecções respiratórias conhecidas na história, como a da Síndrome Respiratória Aguda Grave - SARS (9,5%) e da Síndrome Respiratória do Oriente Médio - MERS, que chegou a uma taxa de mortalidade de 35%.

Portanto, vale ressaltar que a taxa de mortalidade do coronavírus é baixa.

Para mais informações, acompanhe a série de vídeos presentes no nosso canal, em que o Dr. Renato esclarece dúvidas e as principais perguntas sobre o coronavírus.

Leia também o nosso artigo especial sobre o assunto, esclarecendo as principais dúvidas da população:
Coronavírus: especialista esclarece tudo o que se sabe até agora - https://imeb.com.br/coronavirus-tudo-o-que-se-sabe-ate-agora/

suggested_title: A Igreja prostrada diante de um vírus? (Especial Covid-19, #1)

Paulo Ricardo explica por que a Igreja, sem deixar de ser Mãe valente, tem agido com sabedoria ao mesmo tempo previdente, sobrenatural e conforme aos ditames da racionalidade humana.

suggested_title: Covid-19 Brasil | Coronavírus | Como identificar os sintomas e quais as recomendações
suggested_description:
Covid-19 Brasil | Coronavírus | Como identificar os sintomas e quais as recomendações
🔴 Seja parceiro do canal(APOIA-SE): https://apoia.se/canalmaisqi
🔴 Compre estes E-books com desconto: https://amzn.to/39dLDjh
🔴 Acompanhe o canal também pelo Instagram: https://bit.ly/34OyJGI

 Nas últimas semanas estamos sendo bombardeados por informações sobre a chegada dessa pandemia que tem tomado os diversos continentes. 
 E vejo que muitas pessoas não estão dando uma real importância a esta doença altamente contagiosa.
 Por isso, pensei em fazer uma pesquisa em fontes seguras sobre a doença e passar para você algumas dicas e explicações para tentarmos juntos minimizar e quem sabe acabar com este problema que assombra praticamente o mundo inteiro. 
 Inclusive se quiser saber um pouco mais vou deixar nos comentários os sites de onde retirei as informações que compartilharei aqui agora com você! 
 Esse mal surgiu na China em Wuhan, na província de Hubei no dia 1 de dezembro de 2019, em um grupo de pessoas que frequentavam e trabalhavam em um mercado de frutos do mar e animais vivos. 
 Conforme informações dos órgãos de saúde, provavelmente já fomos infectados por alguns dos tipos dessa doença ao longo de nossas vidas.
 A diferença é que a pandemia que tem tomado conta dos diversos países se trata de uma mutação do vírus que já conhecíamos, reagindo de forma diferente em nosso organismo e transmitindo a outras pessoas em uma velocidade muito maior. 
 Como a doença é muito recente, os pesquisadores ainda não têm total certeza de todas as formas de contágio, porem as já relatadas são por meio de: 
 Gotículas de saliva, espirros, tosse, catarro, contato próximo, e contatos com objetos infectados, observando que a infecção ocorre com um posterior contato com a sua boca, nariz e olhos. 
Incubação e sintomas.
 Esta nova doença vem apresentando um tempo de incubação que varia de 2 a 14 dias até que os primeiros sintomas comecem a aparecer, o que faz dele uma doença muito perigosa. 
 Pois a pessoa já pode estar carregando o vírus sem ter ideia disso, e continua entrando em contato com outras pessoas, contaminando mais e mais a população. 
 E este foi o principal fator que levou o vírus a ser considerado uma pandemia, ou seja, ele já pode ser encontrado em praticamente todo o mundo, e tem sido transmitido por pessoas que não tiveram contato direto com os primeiros infectados. 
 Seus sintomas podem ser divididos em 3 classes conforme um estudo realizado pela OMS. 
 O primeiro estado considerado leve e que responde a 80% dos infectados tem como principais sintomas febre, tosse, dor de garganta e em alguns casos, pneumonia. 
 Já os casos classificados como graves, o que demostra cerca de 14% da população infectada, apresenta falta de ar e dificuldade para respirar. 
 E o último grupo crítico de sintomas se apresentando em apenas 6% dos infectados leva a choque séptico, insuficiência pulmonar e falência de órgãos.

SOBRE A REVISTA FÓRUM 

Inspirada no Fórum Social Mundial, a Fórum foi lançada com a cobertura do primeiro evento, realizado em janeiro de 2001 em Porto Alegre. Foi lá na Porto Alegre daqueles que sonhavam um outro mundo possível que a Fórum nasceu. Não é a publicação oficial do FSM, mas a revista traz no seu DNA a força dos movimentos e a certeza de que é na multiplicidade de vozes que se faz um mundo melhor.

O número zero foi lançado em abril daquele 2001 e, devido ao sucesso junto aos movimentos sociais brasileiros, tornou-se periódica ainda em setembro. Até dezembro de 2013, suas edições em papel tiveram circulação mensal de 20 a 25 mil exemplares e eram vendidas em banca. Desde janeiro de 2014, a Fórum é só digital.

Fórum traz, diariamente, matérias, reportagens e entrevistas que buscam uma visão de mundo diferente da presente nos grandes meios de comunicação tradicionais. Hoje é uma das maiores audiências no segmento jornalístico nacional.

suggested_title: Epicentro - 24h em Wuhan | Documentário

O novo coronavírus começou a circular durante a temporada de viagens mais movimentada na China, na qual milhões visitam suas famílias no feriado do Ano Novo Lunar. Em meio ao crescimento da epidemia, uma Wuhan sitiada se mobiliza para salvar aqueles que estão no epicentro da emergência. Numa manobra sem precedentes, a China isolou a grande metrópole na esperança de impedir a disseminação do vírus.

suggested_title: Coronavírus: a cronologia do caos e a ciência na busca por uma saída | Futurando especial
suggested_description:
Confira nesta edição do Futurando especial sobre coronavírus:

1:21 A cronologia do caos: o Futurando refaz a linha do tempo do coronavírus, desde quando, como e onde ele surgiu, em Wuhan, na China, no começo de dezembro de 2019, até quando se espalhou para o mundo todo. 

4:37 Cientistas de todo o mundo estão empenhados em encontrar o mais rapidamente possível uma vacina contra a covid-19, mas ela ainda deve demorar pelo menos um ano e meio para ficar pronta. Por isso, outras ações também são importantes. O Futurando conversou com equipes que analisam, por exemplo, onde o novo coronavírus se multiplica no corpo e que danos pode causar, e com cientistas que querem entender o fluxo de propagação da doença.

8:05 Já se sabe que contrair o coronavírus é muito mais grave para pessoas dos chamados grupos de risco, que incluem pessoas com problemas respiratórios e cardíacos pré-existentes e diabéticos. O programa entrevista especialistas e explica por que cada um desses fatores agrava o quadro dos infectados e que medidas podem ser tomadas para tentar evitar a contaminação. 

13:34 Além de pesquisar uma vacina, grupos de cientistas também se dedicam a desenvolver um medicamento para tratar a covid-19. Na Alemanha, um time estuda com sucesso há muito tempo formas de inibir os vírus ebola, lassa e zika. Acredita-se que essas pesquisas possam ajudar a produzir um medicamento para a doença causada pelo novo coronavírus.

19:27 Muitos países fecharam as fronteiras para conter a disseminação do coronavírus e milhares de voos e muitos cruzeiros foram cancelados. O Futurando conversou com especialistas para saber o quão perigoso é viajar de avião ou de navio. 

22:27 As previsões mais otimistas indicam que uma vacina contra a covid-19 estará pronta em, no mínimo, um ano e meio, apesar dos esforços conjuntos de vários países. Por isso, é importante também investigar alternativas para tratar os pacientes que já estão doentes, uma delas é a imunização passiva. O Futurando explica de que se trata.

suggested_title: Trabalhadores Rodoviários Encontraram Esta Estranha Caixa Enterrada. Veja o Que Havia Dentro Dela!
suggested_description: A civilização humana existe há muito mais de mil anos e a profissão de construtor existe basicamente a mesma quantidade de tempo. As pessoas começaram a construir prédios arquitetônicos na antiguidade e foram passando essa experiência inestimável de geração em geração. Um belo exemplo são as pirâmides egípcias que tem segredos de construção que não foram descobertos até hoje. Em casos raros, o construtor também pode se tornar um arqueólogo, se durante o trabalho algo inesperado foi descoberto acidentalmente no solo. No vídeo de hoje, falaremos justamente sobre as descobertas mais incríveis, encontradas na terra por trabalhadores comuns.

suggested_title: Por que muitas doenças surgem na China?
suggested_description:
COVID19, SARS, Gripe asiática, Influenza A, H2N2... tudo doenças originárias na Ásia e a maioria na China, inclusive a pandemia mais recente. Mas, por quê? Há algo político, biológico ou histórico que possa explicar os últimos surtos?
